intro: Ida andreettae var. andreettae, commonly known as the Andreetta's ida, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
